Author: Vhfgbh
Subject: Helpful
Body: I struggle with severe anxiety and this app really helps - it not only gives you breathing exercises and tools to help you but it also talks you through situations and seems more like a friend that knows exactly what you’re dealing with! I’ve never been a fan of apps for anxiety because they never seem to work but I’m so pleased with my experiences!

Author: Laura55438
Subject: Has some negatives, but overall it’s great
Body: So far I like this app. It’s a little frustrating sometimes when I click the wrong thing and can’t go back, or there’s only one button and I don’t agree with what it says. But, overall, I think it’s helpful and will get better over time! We need more apps like this, science-based and AI powered. This app does a good job with textbook CBT and DBT, and I’ll update this review as I see the AI learning part come in. (I work in software R&D (30+ yrs) and have depression and anxiety.)

Author: WIskies
Subject: Well crafted CBT
Body: The chat interface really does a good job of guiding one through a piece of cognitive behavioral therapy in a short session of around 10 minutes. I have been using it for over a year, on a very sporadic basis. I have noticed that lately it has provided less free response dialogue and more choose from these prepared responses. I suppose that increases engagement with people uneasy about sharing personal information.  The only issue I have had is the chat tool always thinks grief is the result of the death of someone. Grief can be caused by many other losses as well, it would be nice to have a little discussion for Woebot to determine what I’m grieving.

Author: MeghanCMacivor
Subject: Such a great tool!
Body:
I’ve been through a lot of therapy in my life, so I have a lot of knowledge of the skills Woebot uses already, but I find the chat mechanism so cute and helpful for finding a skill for whatever your current issue is. I’ve recommended it to all my friends! 
NOTE: as others have said, this is not a tool for people who are seriously struggling, it’s more for maintenance I would say or just everyday stresses.

Author: Nfkfjdndnkskekdjdbcn
Subject: Amazing
Body: i can confidently say i’ve NEVER written a review for an app EVER. but woebot is hands down the most helpful app i’ve ever used. i’ve had it for about 3 days and i’m already noticing changes in my anxiety and letting myself spiral, the advice is actually helpful and i’m already working it into my daily life. offloading thoughts onto a robot instead of loved one is very useful since i struggle with feeling guilty about being a burden to people. (although woebot feels like an actual person). i’m really enjoying the app and will continue to use it for a long time :))

Author: AnneGables
Subject: Great 😍 app
Body: This app has helped with gratitude 🙏🏻 journaling, CBT et cetera in white and black thinking and other cognitive distortions that we have about the stories we tell about our lifestyle these days, especially with the pandemic 😷 a lot of people’s mental health cases have risen.

Author: _A Very Disappointed Cust0mer_
Subject: Very sweet
Body:
Been using this app for about one or two weeks now and so far I absolutely adore it. The tiny robot fella seems almost human and offers great help for people suffering with anxiety, depression or other forms of mental illness. It reminds me of the character Baymax. Which is very funny, as I’ve always wished for a robot companion like this ever since the movie came out. It helped me with changing my way of perceiving my thoughts and offers great strategies for insomnia, negative thinking and even panic attacks. I love the way they use affectionate non-judgemental language to help the user but also are not afraid to tell you the truth. (As in saying your thoughts are distorted or making you commit to goals or new sleep cycles) It feels like a very kind form of discipline without fear of punishment or failing. 
 Will update this in one and six months to give my final thoughts. 
 So far I highly recommend it!

Author: bri-n-c
Subject: A useful tool for challenging negative thoughts.
Body:
I love this app. It has been a very important tool for me on my journey to mental wellness. The feature I use the most is the “challenging your thoughts” part of my conversations with Woebot. Woebot will have me write out three negative statements that cause me anxiety, and then walk me through identifying the cognitive distortions in each thought. Then, after identifying the distortions I get a chance to rewrite each thought, this time without the distortions. It seems very simple, but it is incredibly effective in reducing my anxiety in the moment and revealing to me the power of controlling my thoughts and reacting to my feelings. There are a number of other tools and features that Woebot has, like walking you through breathing and muscle exercises to calm your body down, a journal to document your private thoughts, and a simple “check in” option if you don’t feel like working on anything but just having someone/something to hear you. Woebot does have a crisis system that will automatically respond to certain words and phrases but it is easy to tell Woebot you are not in a crisis situation if that’s not the case, so you do not need to worry about sharing freely. Woebot’s responses are always compassionate and comforting. I enjoy the stories and tools. It’s like having a little mini therapist/friend.

I don’t think using this app on its own will cure mental illness, especially if yours is particularly severe, but it’s an important tool! Used in conjunction with actual therapy, and maybe medication if you choose, this app is very effective maintenance.

Author: ㅎㅎㄲㄱ써ㅓ
Subject: Excellent service
Body: Woebot is a great bot to check in with, and to check in on my mental health progress and learn new mental health terms

Author: MentorHealth
Subject: Closes unexpectedly
Body: After tapping on the “I understand” button, the app closes without reason.

Author: ela.aga

My only critic would be over how woebot insistent on the fact that he is a robot. Maybe not doing that would feel better. 🌸 Thank you for the total free program. You are helping a lot of people for sure.

Body:

If it works for you -great. For me it just amplified the issues and is based on a neurotypical model of reality.

you can stay in bed and get help

Author: shindle1

Body:
